definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: We honored the fallen police officer with a rifle salute.
sentences.chinese: 我们鸣来复枪向那名殒落的警官致意。

sentences.english: For the sun to rot, for the trees to drop.
sentences.chinese: 太阳腐灼，它从树上殒落。

sentences.english: Now fame, it is fleeting, and stars, they keep falling.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，名望是短暂的，而星星们也不断殒落。

sentences.english: Technology and entertainment are contributing to the fall of civilization.
sentences.chinese: 科技与娱乐加速了文明的殒落。

sentences.english: Falling, the star, flaming, the fire.
His bankruptcy announced the collective falling of the traditional business class.
sentences.chinese: 他的破产，宣告了传统商人阶层的集体殒落。

sentences.english: Saturn is fallen, am I too to fall?
sentences.chinese: 农神殒落了，我是否也将殒落？

sentences.english: Saturn is fallen, am I too to fall?
sentences.chinese: 农神殒落了，我是否也将殒落？

definition: to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
variant of 殞命|殒命[yun3 ming4]/to die/to perish
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to die in a seated posture (Buddhism)
